intro: Thouinia spicata, commonly known as the spiky thouinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually finely divided and aromatic, similar to those of other members of the carrot family. Thouinia spicata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
